TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListView/CheckedListViewItemCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

Docs.summary: Represents the collection of checked items in a list view control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> stores the checked items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. Items can only be checked if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckBoxes%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to `true`. The items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> are items contained in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The following table shows an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> as well as their selection states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
|Index|Item|Checked state in the ListView| |-----------|----------|-----------------------------------| |0|Item1|Unchecked| |1|Item2|Checked| |2|Item3|Unchecked| |3|Item4|Checked| |4|Item5|Checked|
Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> would appear.
|Index|Checked item in ListViewItemCollection| |-----------|--------------------------------------------| |0|Item2| |1|Item4| |2|Item5|
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class is a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>. Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.ListView owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The control that owns the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the item to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.
Docs.returns: if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is a one of the checked items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>. Once you know that an item is in the checked item collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ContainsKey(string key) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the item to search for.
Docs.summary: Determines if a column with the specified key is contained in the collection.
Docs.returns: if an item with the specified key is contained in the collection; otherwise,

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> corresponds to the key for an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

Docs.exception: The owner is in virtual mode.

Docs.param: An representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.
The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.
Docs.summary: Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this method to combine the checked items from multiple collections into a single array.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of items in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables you to determine the number of checked items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. You can then use this value when looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the checked item collection.
Docs.returns: An that represents the checked item collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the item to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the item in the collection; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Once you know that an item is located within the collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where a specific item within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is stored within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOfKey(string key) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the item to retrieve the index for.
Docs.summary: Determines the index for an item with the specified key.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index for the with the specified name, if found; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> corresponds to the key for an item in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

Docs.exception: The owner is in virtual mode.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
Docs.value: if the collection is read-only; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is always `true` for this collection. The items in the collection can only be modified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

Docs.param: The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.
Docs.value: A representing the item located at the specified index within the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This indexer enables you to get a specific item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>. The item stored in this collection is an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a checked item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.

Docs.exception: The parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of .

Docs.param: The key of the item in the collection to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets an item with the specified key within the collection.
Docs.value: A representing the item with the specified index within the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Item%2A> returns `null` if the `key` parameter is `null` or empty.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

Docs.exception: The owner is in virtual mode.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly. To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.IList.Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all items from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly. To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `false` for each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
